net.jforum.dao.generic

Class GenericUserDAO

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.jforum.dao.generic.AutoKeys
      • net.jforum.dao.generic.GenericUserDAO
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    UserDAO
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HsqldbUserDAO, OracleUserDAO, SqlServer2000UserDAO, SqlServerUserDAO

    public class GenericUserDAO
extends AutoKeys
implements UserDAO
    Author:
    Rafael Steil

      • setActive

        public void setActive(int userId,
             boolean active)
        Description copied from interface: UserDAO
        Set the active status. An user with the active status equals to false cannot be considered a "oficial", "fully registered" user until its status is set to true. This is interesting when you want to request user confirmation about registrations, for example
        Specified by:
        setActive in interface UserDAO
        Parameters:
        userId - The user ID to change the status
        active - true or false
        See Also:
        UserDAO.setActive(int, boolean)

      • undelete

        public void undelete(int userId)
        Description copied from interface: UserDAO
        Undeletes an user. The system allows user undeletation because when you call UserDAO.delete(int) the user isn't fisically deleted of the database, but just marked as deleted. This is done to ensure data integrity.
        Specified by:
        undelete in interface UserDAO
        Parameters:
        userId - The user ID to undelete
        See Also:
        UserDAO.undelete(int)

      • writeLostPasswordHash

        public void writeLostPasswordHash(String email,
                         String hash)
        Description copied from interface: UserDAO
        Stores the "lost password" security hash, that was generated when the user asked the system to get a reminder of his password. This hash is used to ensure the information supplied.
        Specified by:
        writeLostPasswordHash in interface UserDAO
        Parameters:
        email - The user email
        hash - The hash to store.
        See Also:

      • findByName

        public List findByName(String input,
              boolean exactMatch)
        Description copied from interface: UserDAO
        Finds an user by matching an input string.
        Specified by:
        findByName in interface UserDAO
        Parameters:
        input - The username to search. May be part of the username. The method will match all users who have the input string as part of their usernames.
        exactMatch - Set to true to get the user data related to the username passed as argument, and set it to false to search all users who match the criteria.
        Returns:
        List with the found users. Each entry is an User object, where only the id and username members are filled.
        See Also:
        UserDAO.findByName(java.lang.String, boolean)

      • updateUsername

        public void updateUsername(int userId,
                  String username)
        Description copied from interface: UserDAO
        Updates only the username. This method generally will be used in implementations of net.jforum.drivers.external.LoginAuthenticator to update usernames which changed in the external source and therefore should be updated in jforum's users table.
        Specified by:
        updateUsername in interface UserDAO
        Parameters:
        userId - The user's id related to the username to update
        username - The new username to write
        See Also:
        UserDAO.updateUsername(int, String)

        public boolean hasUsernameChanged(int userId,
                         String usernameToCheck)
        Description copied from interface: UserDAO
        Check if the username passed as argument is different of the username existent in the database.
        Specified by:
        hasUsernameChanged in interface UserDAO
        Parameters:
        userId - The user's id to work with
        usernameToCheck - The username to compare with the existing one in jforum_users
        Returns:
        true if the usernames are different.
        See Also:
        UserDAO.hasUsernameChanged(int, java.lang.String)
